content:
Create Shifts

To create shifts for particular dates and times when you need coverage and then assign those shifts to agents.

Workforce Engagement is available in Enterprise, Performance, and Unlimited Editions. Shift Scheduling is available in the Contact Center Stock Keeping Unit (SKU), Einstein 1 Service Edition, and Service Suites.

You can create shifts manually, using shift templates, or using shift templates and shift patterns.

Required permissions: Shift Scheduling Planner OR Workforce Engagement Planner.

To create a manual shift:

Open Shifts in the App Launcher.
Select a list view from the dropdown menu.
Change to the schedule view.
Hover over the calendar in the column for the date you want this shift to occur on, and click + New Shift.
Select a start and end time for the shift.
Select a shift status (Tentative, Published, Confirmed).
Add the service territory and job profile.
Select a service resource.
Click Save.

To create shifts using templates:

Create shift templates with pre-populated fields.
Build repeating shift patterns that list the shift templates to use each day.
Use the New from Pattern action to quickly create shifts from templates.

You can also add shifts directly from your short-term capacity plan in Workforce Engagement.
title: Shift Scheduling in Service Cloud
